channel.title: Business News
channel.description: Latest headlines for business news around the world.

item.title: A new labor battle opens on Broadway as omicron closes theater shows
item.description: Broadway producer Keven McCollum closed 'Mrs. Doubtfire' with a plan to return in the spring, he says, to save the show, but theater unions are skeptical.

item.title: Labor Department vows to protect workers from Covid after Supreme Court blocks business vaccine mandate
item.description: Unions are calling for the Labor Department to implement improved ventilation, physical distancing and masking in workplaces.

item.title: Thieves target another source for stolen goods: Delivery trucks and trains full of packages
item.description: Major retailers, including Target and Best Buy, have spoken out about organized thefts and urged Congress to make it harder for criminals to sell stolen goods.

item.title: New York Covid numbers are finally trending down, Gov. Hochul says
item.description: "There will come a time when we can say it's all over," Hochul said of Covid "We're not there yet, but boy, it's on the horizon."

item.title: GE suspends Covid vaccine and testing rules after Supreme Court blocks Biden mandate
item.description: President Joe Biden said he would urge businesses to implement the rules voluntarily.

item.title: Retail industry presses ahead with conference, tries to nudge Americans toward normalcy
item.description: The National Retail Federation said it will take extra precautions, including handing out N95 masks and at-home Covid tests.

item.title: The U.S. hopes the threat of harsh sanctions deters a Russian invasion of Ukraine—Here's how they work
item.description: Russia is amassing troops on its border with Ukraine. The U.S. and its allies plan to use economic sanctions to deter an invasion. Here's how they work.

item.title: Biden administration threatens to claw back Covid funds from Arizona over school anti-mask policies
item.description: GOP Gov. Doug Ducey has 60 days to change the disputed programs or the Biden administration may take back that Covid stimulus money, Treasury said.

item.title: United brings back airport vaccines for employee boosters as omicron spreads
item.description: United has started offering staff vaccines in airports again as the omicron wave sweeps through crews.

item.title: Bill Ford is doubling down on Ford shares, and quietly amassing more control of his great-grandfather's company in the process
item.description: The decision to purchase the shares bucks a recent trend by CEOs and corporate insiders who sold a record $69 billion in stock in 2021.

item.title: One of the world's biggest offshore wind farms gears up for full operations
item.description: The North Sea, where Triton Knoll is located, is home to a number of large-scale offshore wind facilities.

item.title: Here's the full list of the best-selling electric cars in China for 2021
item.description: Tesla and BYD remained market leaders in China's electric car market last year, while new competitors emerged, according to the China Passenger Car Association.

item.title: Australia cancels Novak Djokovic's visa for the second time
item.description: Tennis star Novak Djokovic has had his visa canceled once again ahead of the Australian Open as the furor over his vaccination status intensifies.

item.title: 5 things to know before the stock market opens Friday
item.description: U.S. stock futures accelerated to the downside Friday after Dow stock JPMorgan dropped and retail sales disappointed.

item.title: India's third wave of Covid infections is expected to blunt growth in the near term
item.description: But the overall economic impact of the third wave of infections is expected to be less severe and less disruptive compared to the previous two waves.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: BlackRock, Wells Fargo, Sherwin-Williams
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

item.title: Retail sales dropped 1.9% in December as higher prices caused consumers to curb spending
item.description: The advance monthly sales report to close out the year showed a decline of 1.9%, considerably worse than the Dow Jones estimate for just a 0.1% drop.

item.title: Supreme Court vaccine mandate ruling won't bar companies from demanding Covid shots for workers — Biden vows to advocate for that
item.description: President Biden urged companies to voluntarily impose Covid vaccination rules on workers after the Supreme Court blocked a government order to do that.

item.title: Soaring used car prices are pushing inflation higher, and there's not much the U.S. can do about it
item.description: The potential upside for President Biden is that inflation is expected to moderate organically and as the Fed looks to raise interest rates this year.

item.title: 'Scream' looks to draw in young horror fans and jumpstart 2022 box office
item.description: The fifth installment of the "Scream" franchise is projected to tally between $25 million and $30 million in U.S. ticket sales this weekend, Comscore said.

item.title: Mastercard CEO says spending trends look ‘relatively positive’ so far in 2022 after strong holiday
item.description: "We're coming with a momentum of the holiday season into the new year and trends continue to look relatively positive," Mastercard CEO Michael Miebach said.

item.title: Supreme Court blocks Biden Covid vaccine mandate for businesses, allows health-care worker rule
item.description: The Supreme Court ruled against the Biden administration's rule for OSHA, saying it did not have the power to require vaccination for millions of Americans.

item.title: Biden says U.S. to provide high-quality masks for free to Americans
item.description: President Joe Biden said the White House next week will announce how it is providing high-quality masks to Americans for free.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Ford, Snap, Virgin Galactic and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Ford's market cap tops $100 billion for first time ever
item.description: Ford shares were up by as much as 5.7% to $25.87, continuing a more than 20-year high for the automaker's stock price.

item.title: 'Green' fuels will cost the consumer — but we need to think long term, Maersk CEO says
item.description: Shipping is not unique in attempting to find more sustainable ways of powering operations.

item.title: Biden deploys military medical teams to hospitals in six states as omicron disrupts essential services
item.description: The federal government will deploy six teams of military medical personnel to hospitals in New York, New Jersey, Ohio, Rhode Island, Michigan and New Mexico.

item.title: Delta CEO says 8,000 employees have tested positive for Covid in last 4 weeks
item.description: Delta's CEO says the operation has since stabilized.

item.title: Databricks CEO dismisses cloud sell-off, says growth rates will determine valuations
item.description: Databricks, valued last year at $38 billion, is now focusing on industries such as retail, and its CEO isn't worried about a cloud sell-off in recent weeks.

item.title: Virgin Galactic stock falls after announcing plans to add up to $500 million in debt
item.description: Shares of Virgin Galactic fell in trading on Thursday after the space tourism company announced plans to raise up to $500 million in debt.
